content:
Posted: December 10, 2016
Early Access Review
ReviewThis game is immersive, beautiful and has next to no performance issues. It also has devs that actively talk with members of the community in hopes of making the game better in any way they can, despite it missing some features, it is a mostly fully functional Zombie Survival/PVP game, it even features wild life that can destroy you (my story below goes into this further), pick this up, play it for however long you want, you can always come back to it a few months later and be greeted with some new content/features. This game can make your heart beat fast, it can make you second-guess your morals. Ammo is usually hard to find but guns can be quite easy to come across if you look in built up areas (towns, the city, heck, even some stores). This is the end of my review, the rest of the "review" will be the story of my first life. The Story of my First Life This all took place in my first life, my first time playing the game. I spawned at the edge of a forest, I saw a few houses ahead, it was almost pitch-black, I went ahead and looted them, only finding a hatchet and a few useless pistol mags, I was shining my trusty flashlight in the house, it illuminating the house with me unaware. I heard a guy call out to me, turns out him and his buddy were just some friendly guys in the middle of nowhere with some assualt rifles, I followed them around a bit before we began looting the rest of this small town we ended up in, we walked into the forest for whatever reason and supposedly we were going to the city, so I tagged along, in the very waking hours of the morning, the sun just rising above the treeline we heard howls, it was the wolves, they began shooting at the wolves, it was a huge pack of them, easily 20 or more of them, I made a ran for it after being told they would hold them back, leaving them behind in hopes they make it out alive, they didn't, I never heard from them again. I was at the edge of the forest now and the sun had risen, I was now inside a large town, not a city but pretty huge. I came across roughly 15-20 people in the town, all looting, everyone was friendly, no one had guns, at least we thought so, I was looting a department store when outside out the corner of my eye I notice a taxi, it wasn't in a condition to drive but it was close enough, all it needed was spark plugs, two wheels, some oil and some fuel. I set out to look for it before coming across 2 people, both of them were friends and completely new to the game like me, so I told them about the car and what we needed and we set out to raid the town of every piece we needed, we managed to find spark plugs, oil and the two wheels but we lacked fuel, we couldn't find it anywhere. Anyway we went back to the car to install the components we had recently found around the town, before having a sit down and talking for about 10 minutes about how we're gonna find fuel and where we could, we were about to head to a nerby "Gas Station" before being stopped by what we thought was a fellow peer, he was on top of the department store, he offered us fuel for some of our clothing, we thought to ourselves, "it's a fair deal, why not!" but before we knew it he shot one of us in the leg, luckily we were already behind the taxi so I made my T-Shirt into a rag and used it as a bandage to stop him from bleeding, after we fixed up his leg we made a run for it, the gunman tried to shoot us as we started our run for safety, we bolted through the department store and ran into a nearby forest, he got a shot in my lower back, I was bleeding heavily, the gun man was still chasing us but he had to climb down off the roof so we were a good 50m ahead of him, next thing we knew, we were in the middle of a forest being amushed by a pack of wolves. We ran away from the town because we would've got shot if we was to head back to the town, so we ran to the other side of the forest, long behold our saviour, a massive water tower that was taller than anything we saw in the town, all 3 of us safely made it up the ladder but I was bleeding hard, luckily I had a spare rag and I stopped my bleeding just in time, I was on 2% HP, on the brink of death. Just as we thought we were safe and we made our way down the ladder, we heard more wrenching growls from the Wolves below, they waited for us to come down (now thats some impressive AI), I can't say how fast we climbed straight back up the ladder. We figured out a plan, 2 of us had axes, me and 1 of the others, I was on 2% HP, I was hungry, thirsty and I don't believe I could make it, I gave the axe to the unarmed one, in true heroic fashion they said to me, "You'll make it threw, we'll make sure of it." Those words have stuck with me since, I watched over them as they climbed down the ladder. I wished them luck and watched some fight off the wolves, I watched my only 2 friends get mauled to death by a pack of wolves, before my eyes, I couldn't take it anymore, I was hungry, thirsty and afraid. I made a decision honour their death and try to make a run for it, it was suicide for sure but if I could make it through, I could live to tell the tale. I ran for my life but the wolves were too fast for my frail, injured body. I died that very day.Thats my story. Edit: What is happening currently! I came across a player who thought I was going to shoot him on sight, I didn't so then we headed off to see his friends, we ended messing around for 10 hours and now we have loads of resources, tonnes of vehicles, tonnes of weapons and some ammo. We are the most powerful people in the server. I recommend playing this game with friends or trying to find a group of people to play with, it can make this game 1000x more fun.

content:
Posted: December 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								Early Access Alpha Review: I've played many survival games, so for those who are veterans to the genre you will already feel like you know the game. The devs have done a good job paying attention to detail, the world is immersive and most buildings and houses have the ability to scour through them for loot. This game has the feel of a little of H1Z1 and DayZ combined together, just to give you an idea of what to expect.I find the community in this game to be a lot better than the usual KOS type that comes with most survival games. Many people will communicate, even if they plan to kill you. In my opinion having a little RP or dialogue goes a long way with these games and you will find more often than not people are willing to help or at least chat a bit before you get shot in the head.The cost is very good, I got it on sale for $10. For an EA you can't beat that price and you get more content than what is still yet to even come in other titles like DayZ standalone. I usually steer clear of early access titles but I saw how much the devs work on the game and are transparent with updates as well as having very positive reviews from others. I would recommend this to anyone who is a fan of survival games at a fair price.It's a mostly PVP focused game but there are some infected mutants to give you PVE. The infected which are like your undead zombies are at random around the map. The AI is a bit wonky with them but it's not terrible and there are even special ones that do more damage or are quite large behemoths that take a lot of ammo to take down. You won't find any huge hoards (yet) but you also have animals like wolves to be a threat to your survival as well.Vehicles are a bit buggy at times, they can get stuck on the random object or bounce around quite a bit, but still aren't terrible. Weapons are pretty easy to acquire but ammo isn't, so conserving your shots for key opportunities are critical. There are cool survival items like the walkie talkie which allows you to communicate with other survivors who also have one handy. There are just a lot of immersion adding elements, even the ambient sound is a scary at times. I would say the gun firing sounds need some improvement but they aren't horrible either.Overall the game is pretty well done for an alpha and I'm excited to see what comes down the pipe during further development. I wouldn't hestitate to buy now, especially if it's on sale.TL;DR - If you like survival horror, you want PVP, immersion, base building, good graphics that don't hog your system and a cool world than look no further. Miscreated has a lot of what other titles like DayZ still haven't even provided years into development.

content:
Posted: January 26
Early Access Review
								I love the game to death, it's really fun to play, even by yourself. The graphics in this game is amazing, even on the lowest setting! Theres a various ammount of locations around the world to visit and they are place in a reasonable distance between each other. When you go to visit any of these locations, theres a 'story' to it I guess you can say, and there's ALOT of detail in buildings and cities arcoss the map. I also like the fact that the devs usually work on bugs in the game before adding anything, I will say the game is still buggy, but it's in much better shape then when I got it. Heres the thing that doesn't stop me from playing, the community. When your in a server it's not like dayz (for the most part) you dont just walk into the towns and then get shot right after. Most times when I met a person on a server, it would end peacefully, I would have either diecided to join them for a bit, or just traded some supplies then go seperate ways. Yes like all survival games there are KOS'ers but unless you're on a server with 2 clans in the middle of a war, there aren't many times where I can recall getting killed on sight. If theres one thing I would like to see be fix or improve, is the base building. I know they stated this in the 'State of the Game' Announcement, but I would like to see it improve, especially with how many storage crates a land plot can hold.

content:
Posted: November 29, 2016
Early Access Review
Top game this is i'll tell you.At the time of writing this review I may not have as many hours as you could possibly want me to, but even as a beginner Miscreated has given me some of the best experiences playing games that I could ever get.Once you log onto a server you are spawned into nowhere, only with clothes and nothing else. You will have no idea where you are, and with no map you will have to use the roadsigns to guide your way into towns/cities. But during that journey, you'll have to loot. Going in different houses, picking up gear from locations etc. Takes some time to do on your own (especially if a beginner) so try to pair up with somebody you trust and go ahead with finding loot. Once you get the hang of that, you'll hopefully have a gun, ammo, food and clothes. Even a ride if you get lucky.While looting you'll come accross zombies and all, and these can be difficult to deal with especially if you don't have any gear on you. Now, once you get your loot the best part of this game comes.PVP.You're going to be doing it whether you like it or not, and while your at it your heart is going to be racing incredibly fast. The thought of losing everything and having to start again will scare you, but you must overcome it.Even after the fights are over, your adrenaline will still be there and you'll love it.While I'm not going to compare it to other titles (as that's not neccesarily a good thing to do anyway), you'll come to find that the developers actually listen to their players and very often hand out updates and communicate with us. Also, this is a game that can give you one of the best experiences you will ever get from a game.

content:
Posted: November 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								Miscreated is admittedly not going to be for everyone, but if you're a fan of the survival genre I would recommend picking it up. Especially if you're a Dayz fan and trying to painfully tredge through the current state of the standalone game, Miscreated is a real throwback to the old days when the Dayz mod first surfaced and really kicked off the survival genre. It's actually quite similar in very many ways, and forgoes all the flair and over complexity that you see in all these other survival games coming out and brings everything back to it's roots without levels, stats, and a craft focus (though it does have some minimal crafting elements), At the same time, it learns from Dayz and incorporates some minimalistic things people wanted during that time, such as base building, heavier populated map (although smaller), mix & match clothes wear, and overall better terrain and scenary.. not to mention caves!Of course, it's not the end all either. Like any other game, it's got skeletons in the closet that must be addressed as well. That being said, any of this is likely subject to change or being fixed, so take it with an open mind and a grain of salt.. they're just things to keep in mind when you're considering hitting that purchase button... This is just how the game is presented in it's current state. Despite this review being positive, it's actually the negatives that I want to cover here below because, honestly, all the good stuff I feel you should see for yourself and it comes through playing the game.Firstly, although there is currently basebuilding, it's not very intuitive in the least. Theres no option for a snap function that allows you to line up pieces easily, so you're sort of stuck jimmying it around until it "looks good enough". Now, I'm not saying you cannot lay out a really extravant build.. I've seen some insane builds on there that of just made me have to stop and say "how", but for those who may not have the time or patience for taking all that time to line up that wall perfectly might find themselves becoming agitated when their base ends up not coming together right. I'm all for having the option to freely place base pieces... I love that you can, but a snap function would be nice, just saying. Bases are also currently marked and protected by land plot signs that MUST be placed on terrain. That's fine and all.... except, the problem here lies in the fact that the sign CANNOT be destroyed unless all existing pieces of the base are destroyed first. "So what?"... yeah, I get it, you aren't out to destroy their entire base or take it from them, neither am I honestly.. just want some of that mad loot am I right? See, the problem there is that the game has no structural integrity for building. What this means is that people can create buildings that are floating off the ground, rendering them inaccessible by NORMAL means and theres nothing you can do about it since the area is claimed and protected and you can't build. There are ways to get to a floating base depending on how it's build and if you have access to the right things, but my point is that people shouldn't have to go through having to boost their way up in the first place!Secondly, storage..... I'll just come out and say it, most people hate how it's currently handled. You're limited to a single 10 slot box, and a single 20 slot box of BUILDABLE storage for your base. This is going to net you a total of 30 slots, mind you... you have to find the guide/blue print before you can even build the 20 slot box. Alternatively, you also have the option of storing items into tents of various sizes, and in vehicles as well... all of which the savy base builder will make accomodations for having available space in their base for. I get what the developers are going for here, and they've said it themselves. They don't want people hoarding items away and then never having to do anything about going out to get them, and yeah... I understand that, but still I think limiting it to just 30 slots buildable is just a little overdoing it, I'd at LEAST like to see about 50, or even just give people the option of building two of each box. You also may not store, and can only carry one single back pack at a time...which is on your back, that's it. Yes... even empty backpacks. Thirdly, and relatively short. Headshots are a little.... "hit and miss" at the moment. It's a widely known issue, but for some reason there exists a problem where headshots will not always one hit kill people, and other times it will. See the issue with that is that it is in fact NOT a feature. Headshots are supposed to be one hit kills, but for some reason doesn't always work out that way currently. If you should ever have a moment where this happens, don't be surprised, it's happens very commonly and for everyone. To my knowledge I do believe that they still take damage nevertheless, so.. I suppose it's better than nothing. Overall, I'd say it's worth the pick up, especially if you can get it in a sale. It does some things right, it does others wrong.. you be the judge of what you like, what you hate, and what you're willing to tollerate. If you want Dayz the way it should of been though, yeah, this is probably it if the developers take it in the right direction. Pros:+ Good, cleanly running graphics & FPS+ Beautiful map with many locations, buildings, and dense shrub and forest as well as caves+ Ammunition is found in random, oftenly low amounts with guns and around the map (no more 1 gun warrior pick ups) + May only carry 2 primary weapons (no one man armies either, and makes you consider your options when raiding)+ May carry as many secondary weapons as your weight allows it+ Base Building+ Vehicles with easy parts&repair system+ Clothes variety (with your inventory slots dependant on the clothes you are wearing) + No freaking annoying sprint stamina!+ Jumping stamina! (limited bunny hopping)+ No overcomplicated systems and RPG wannabe elements (just you, your gun, and your base..and maybe that guy you have handcuffed in the corner)+/- Weapon attachments (This one is a tricky one because they're JUST starting to mess with this, and the only current attachments are flashlights for some primary weapons and a scope for the M40 sniper) Cons:+ Weird audio issues (things don't always sound like they're coming from where they should be, footsteps lag so you might mistake your own self for being someone else and become paranoid, sometimes explosions and gunshots are completely silent)+ Weight limit (I know.. realism, but honestly really all it does is make base building a pain in theâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥+ Base building is unintuitive+ Craft menu browsing is unintuitive+ Crafting is.... SUPER unintuitive (you can only craft one single thing at a time, no queue, must remain in crafting menu,  and you must click the craft button for every single object you craft) + Low buildable storage amount+ Abusable floating base building+ May only carry one back pack on you (only the one on your back), and cannot store them in storage+ Buggy headshots (headshots do not always one hit kill)

content:
Posted: June 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								For an alpha game it seems quite basic, however I have only just started playing this a couple days ago and I must say the weather effects in this game are absolutely brilliant. This game gives you the rust / day z feel even though it is in early stages and at times it gives me the jumps when it becomes foggy and you bump into someone in a dark house.The houses in this game are really unique in my opinion as they are all different and offer some diversity but what I'd like to see improved on would be the houses itself. Often in houses you see the odd bordered up window and doors but why not allow the players to fortify some structures and households? Nails, wood, hammer, etc and bam bingo you could close the curtains, border up broken doors / windows and essentially live there as a temp base. So far in the survival games out there I have not seen many that allow a feature like this and it is something I would greatly welcome.Also what I have noticed though while playing is the lack of mutants, I only seem to come accross one or two and as your typical survivor game it is running simulator all over again along with a lot of kill on sight players.With that being said, there are quite a lot of cars you can find so transport is not an issue, but you may be spending an hour to find the parts to get it running. (Or I am a noob and don't know the obvious places.) If I was to rate this game would give it a 6.5 or 7/10 for now as there is a lot of work to do but bearing in mind it is still in alpha.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 9, 2016
Early Access Review
								Miscreated is a promising survival fps with crafting & base building. At the time of making this review the game is very well optimized with impressive dynamic shadows and a large but somewhat barren landscape. Mutants & other players pose as the main threat although mutants are very rarely spotted, much like the zombies in DayZ. Exploration feels refreshing at first. You can enter every single building in the game world and loot melts in very well with the environment. I found it much easier to find them using my flashlight since all the small items on the floor and on shelves would cast shadows. Itâ€™s a small game mechanic that really gives it a lot of atmosphere. It does feel like it becomes somewhat repetitive after a while though. Itâ€™s very time consuming to keep scouring every corner of a building in the hopes of finding some elusive ammunition and there doesnâ€™t seem to be a lot of items in the game yet so thereâ€™s a lot of the same oâ€™ same oâ€™. The sound is the games large downfall in my opinion. Itâ€™s awful.  The sound of gunshots does not have any dynamic. Even if youâ€™re in an open field and fire a revolver thereâ€™s no echo. It sounds as if youâ€™re firing it in a soundproof booth and it kind of just cuts off before the sound played through properly. Some effects sound very loud as if the source of the sound is very close to you although it could be a block away. The sound of footsteps sometimes repeat, making it sound as if thereâ€™s somebody else in the same building as you. Very annoying. I do however understand that this is an early access title and that these are all issues that will probably be fixed eventually. Itâ€™s a good game for what it is & I am sure it will eventually be a very good survival game. Worth the price right now? I would probably wait but keep a close eye on it. Buy it at a discount. If you love survival games but youâ€™re tired of DayZ Iâ€™d give this one a go.

content:
Posted: June 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								For an alpha game it seems quite basic, however I have only just started playing this a couple days ago and I must say the weather effects in this game are absolutely brilliant. This game gives you the rust / day z feel even though it is in early stages and at times it gives me the jumps when it becomes foggy and you bump into someone in a dark house.The houses in this game are really unique in my opinion as they are all different and offer some diversity but what I'd like to see improved on would be the houses itself. Often in houses you see the odd bordered up window and doors but why not allow the players to fortify some structures and households? Nails, wood, hammer, etc and bam bingo you could close the curtains, border up broken doors / windows and essentially live there as a temp base. So far in the survival games out there I have not seen many that allow a feature like this and it is something I would greatly welcome.Also what I have noticed though while playing is the lack of mutants, I only seem to come accross one or two and as your typical survivor game it is running simulator all over again along with a lot of kill on sight players.With that being said, there are quite a lot of cars you can find so transport is not an issue, but you may be spending an hour to find the parts to get it running. (Or I am a noob and don't know the obvious places.) If I was to rate this game would give it a 6.5 or 7/10 for now as there is a lot of work to do but bearing in mind it is still in alpha.

content:
Posted: July 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								So, I noticed this game had a couple of updates since I last saw it. As a result I decided to give it a shot after all this time since launch. ProsAtmosphereEnviromentWeatherGunplayRarity of Guns & AmmoPrice Point ($20)ConsLimited MapLack of ContentVehicle IssuesCrashing somewhat frequentVarious BugsMisleading Steam PageThe game is indeed fun. I have enjoyed my time with it so far and will probably continue playing it, but all in all the game is a two year old Alpha early access title. It's still has numerous bugs and crashing issues. A seriously lack of content for how much development time it has had. Despite that, If you enjoy the survival genre, this game is probably worth picking up and seeing what you can get out of it. For $20, you have a decent chance of getting your money's worth out of it and I am sure they will continue to add content to the game even if it is at a painfully slow pace. On the other hand, if money is tight around your household I would recommend holding off on this title and save your money or invest into into a more complete title, such as DayZ if you're looking for a more hardcore experience or Shattered Skies/H1Z1 for a more shoot em up gameplay style.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								Early Access Alpha Review: I've played many survival games, so for those who are veterans to the genre you will already feel like you know the game. The devs have done a good job paying attention to detail, the world is immersive and most buildings and houses have the ability to scour through them for loot. This game has the feel of a little of H1Z1 and DayZ combined together, just to give you an idea of what to expect.I find the community in this game to be a lot better than the usual KOS type that comes with most survival games. Many people will communicate, even if they plan to kill you. In my opinion having a little RP or dialogue goes a long way with these games and you will find more often than not people are willing to help or at least chat a bit before you get shot in the head.The cost is very good, I got it on sale for $10. For an EA you can't beat that price and you get more content than what is still yet to even come in other titles like DayZ standalone. I usually steer clear of early access titles but I saw how much the devs work on the game and are transparent with updates as well as having very positive reviews from others. I would recommend this to anyone who is a fan of survival games at a fair price.It's a mostly PVP focused game but there are some infected mutants to give you PVE. The infected which are like your undead zombies are at random around the map. The AI is a bit wonky with them but it's not terrible and there are even special ones that do more damage or are quite large behemoths that take a lot of ammo to take down. You won't find any huge hoards (yet) but you also have animals like wolves to be a threat to your survival as well.Vehicles are a bit buggy at times, they can get stuck on the random object or bounce around quite a bit, but still aren't terrible. Weapons are pretty easy to acquire but ammo isn't, so conserving your shots for key opportunities are critical. There are cool survival items like the walkie talkie which allows you to communicate with other survivors who also have one handy. There are just a lot of immersion adding elements, even the ambient sound is a scary at times. I would say the gun firing sounds need some improvement but they aren't horrible either.Overall the game is pretty well done for an alpha and I'm excited to see what comes down the pipe during further development. I wouldn't hestitate to buy now, especially if it's on sale.TL;DR - If you like survival horror, you want PVP, immersion, base building, good graphics that don't hog your system and a cool world than look no further. Miscreated has a lot of what other titles like DayZ still haven't even provided years into development.

number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								Hello, I am Steven and I have played 33.3 Hrs on record. I must say that in the beginning the game was pretty bad and had a lot to catch up on. Because a lot of other zombie survivals were already alot ahead, this game was essentially thrown under the bus. People tend to not read as well because it says PRE-ALPHA yet they still rate it bad because they expect a full game, when it is clearly stated on Steam AND startup. This game has developed in a short time, but is already ahead most other zombie survivals. It has good mechanics for walking, running, looting, good inventory setup, UI is good, however they could add an auto-run feature because after awhile your pinky finger tends to start to hurt, but other than that basic mechanics are good. The player-base is pretty friendly and not everyone is a KOS, I actually have made a few friends with people who were completely looted to the teeth and did not KOS me on sight. The game is absolutly beautiful for being a newer survival game (Thank you Cry-Engine). I was actually stunned how good the game was when it first came out, and even more things have made it stand out. There are signs posted around the map to really help find your positioning, literally... every town has at least 4 signs describing your location.. or just blatantly stating it. Overall I think it is worth the buy because unlike other survivals this game is heading up-hill at a fast, yet precise rate. The devs always are in contact with the player-base and they always have hotfixes if there are any problems with a new update that was release and had issues. Please, if you are interested at all in buying this game (Which not to mention I have found no hackers / scripters, ect. to be in) at all please take the time to read the NEWEST feedback on the game. Plus your contribution to buying the game will help the Devs create even more fun things to do in future releases. Hope this helps, happy playing! :)

content:
Posted: February 29, 2016
Early Access Review
								Game is already awesome! And also very promising (OC it takes time to get somewhat near perfection).- PvP is awesome: You can form groups and hunt other players to loot for weapons, bullets and resources.- Sensation of fear! You probably won't care too much about dying if you have nothing to lose, but when you do, you surely will think twice (or a dozen times) before turning each corner.- Survival for the smartest! As a post apocalyptic world, battle for resources are unavoidable! And I'd say that having the best gun handed is not always the key to survive (nor to kill)! You have to have a brain (a good one)! You have be aware of the sounds. You have to watch all the area arround. You have to hide in shadows, and wait to strike at the right time! That's the key to survive!Well, I would point a lot of things that I like (and that I liked even more after the twitch stream), but opinions are unique.I'm aware that what please me, do not please others.- Mutants (and other AI) glitching, and with nothing to loot.- Items disapearing.- Not much craft variety (that goes for structures/resources/weapons)- other stuffAnyway. Those above were promised to be fixed sometime in the future... It's a relief for me, and I believe the Dev guys.I know it might take them some time to get all that stuff ready. But they can't get too lazy :vI think they should also work on things to do in long time play (and since the map has large areas full of nothing...).

content:
Posted: November 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								Miscreated is admittedly not going to be for everyone, but if you're a fan of the survival genre I would recommend picking it up. Especially if you're a Dayz fan and trying to painfully tredge through the current state of the standalone game, Miscreated is a real throwback to the old days when the Dayz mod first surfaced and really kicked off the survival genre. It's actually quite similar in very many ways, and forgoes all the flair and over complexity that you see in all these other survival games coming out and brings everything back to it's roots without levels, stats, and a craft focus (though it does have some minimal crafting elements), At the same time, it learns from Dayz and incorporates some minimalistic things people wanted during that time, such as base building, heavier populated map (although smaller), mix & match clothes wear, and overall better terrain and scenary.. not to mention caves!Of course, it's not the end all either. Like any other game, it's got skeletons in the closet that must be addressed as well. That being said, any of this is likely subject to change or being fixed, so take it with an open mind and a grain of salt.. they're just things to keep in mind when you're considering hitting that purchase button... This is just how the game is presented in it's current state. Despite this review being positive, it's actually the negatives that I want to cover here below because, honestly, all the good stuff I feel you should see for yourself and it comes through playing the game.Firstly, although there is currently basebuilding, it's not very intuitive in the least. Theres no option for a snap function that allows you to line up pieces easily, so you're sort of stuck jimmying it around until it "looks good enough". Now, I'm not saying you cannot lay out a really extravant build.. I've seen some insane builds on there that of just made me have to stop and say "how", but for those who may not have the time or patience for taking all that time to line up that wall perfectly might find themselves becoming agitated when their base ends up not coming together right. I'm all for having the option to freely place base pieces... I love that you can, but a snap function would be nice, just saying. Bases are also currently marked and protected by land plot signs that MUST be placed on terrain. That's fine and all.... except, the problem here lies in the fact that the sign CANNOT be destroyed unless all existing pieces of the base are destroyed first. "So what?"... yeah, I get it, you aren't out to destroy their entire base or take it from them, neither am I honestly.. just want some of that mad loot am I right? See, the problem there is that the game has no structural integrity for building. What this means is that people can create buildings that are floating off the ground, rendering them inaccessible by NORMAL means and theres nothing you can do about it since the area is claimed and protected and you can't build. There are ways to get to a floating base depending on how it's build and if you have access to the right things, but my point is that people shouldn't have to go through having to boost their way up in the first place!Secondly, storage..... I'll just come out and say it, most people hate how it's currently handled. You're limited to a single 10 slot box, and a single 20 slot box of BUILDABLE storage for your base. This is going to net you a total of 30 slots, mind you... you have to find the guide/blue print before you can even build the 20 slot box. Alternatively, you also have the option of storing items into tents of various sizes, and in vehicles as well... all of which the savy base builder will make accomodations for having available space in their base for. I get what the developers are going for here, and they've said it themselves. They don't want people hoarding items away and then never having to do anything about going out to get them, and yeah... I understand that, but still I think limiting it to just 30 slots buildable is just a little overdoing it, I'd at LEAST like to see about 50, or even just give people the option of building two of each box. You also may not store, and can only carry one single back pack at a time...which is on your back, that's it. Yes... even empty backpacks. Thirdly, and relatively short. Headshots are a little.... "hit and miss" at the moment. It's a widely known issue, but for some reason there exists a problem where headshots will not always one hit kill people, and other times it will. See the issue with that is that it is in fact NOT a feature. Headshots are supposed to be one hit kills, but for some reason doesn't always work out that way currently. If you should ever have a moment where this happens, don't be surprised, it's happens very commonly and for everyone. To my knowledge I do believe that they still take damage nevertheless, so.. I suppose it's better than nothing. Overall, I'd say it's worth the pick up, especially if you can get it in a sale. It does some things right, it does others wrong.. you be the judge of what you like, what you hate, and what you're willing to tollerate. If you want Dayz the way it should of been though, yeah, this is probably it if the developers take it in the right direction. Pros:+ Good, cleanly running graphics & FPS+ Beautiful map with many locations, buildings, and dense shrub and forest as well as caves+ Ammunition is found in random, oftenly low amounts with guns and around the map (no more 1 gun warrior pick ups) + May only carry 2 primary weapons (no one man armies either, and makes you consider your options when raiding)+ May carry as many secondary weapons as your weight allows it+ Base Building+ Vehicles with easy parts&repair system+ Clothes variety (with your inventory slots dependant on the clothes you are wearing) + No freaking annoying sprint stamina!+ Jumping stamina! (limited bunny hopping)+ No overcomplicated systems and RPG wannabe elements (just you, your gun, and your base..and maybe that guy you have handcuffed in the corner)+/- Weapon attachments (This one is a tricky one because they're JUST starting to mess with this, and the only current attachments are flashlights for some primary weapons and a scope for the M40 sniper) Cons:+ Weird audio issues (things don't always sound like they're coming from where they should be, footsteps lag so you might mistake your own self for being someone else and become paranoid, sometimes explosions and gunshots are completely silent)+ Weight limit (I know.. realism, but honestly really all it does is make base building a pain in theâ™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥+ Base building is unintuitive+ Craft menu browsing is unintuitive+ Crafting is.... SUPER unintuitive (you can only craft one single thing at a time, no queue, must remain in crafting menu,  and you must click the craft button for every single object you craft) + Low buildable storage amount+ Abusable floating base building+ May only carry one back pack on you (only the one on your back), and cannot store them in storage+ Buggy headshots (headshots do not always one hit kill)

content:
Posted: April 25, 2016
Early Access Review
My Miscreated ReviewOne of my 3 favorite games. The game does have lots of bugs, but with every con, their is a pro. Pros:   Fun co-op  Friendly community  Easy to learn  Intense action  Cons  Has a few bugs, mainly with Mutants  Has only 36 player slot on servers current  You can get stuck on things often   Sometimes ammo will be gone after logging on Things I want added to Miscreated  Be able to prone  Combine ammo clips *For example, I have 5 bullets in one clip and 5 in the other, I would be able to combine them  Better optimization (Not bad, but also not the best)  Higher spawns  More slots to servers  More variety of scoped/long range weapons Should you buy it? If you like survival games like H1Z1, DayZ, or Rust, this is a game that you are going to really like. When I bought the game there was an average of about 250 people on, and around 100 on during night time/early morning hours. Now I have seen it at an average of 600-700 people! The game is really growing after Patch #35 which added a "Weather System" and a sneak peak of the new town. Currently the new town is just being called "Downtown" which includes a skyscraper and many houses, gas stations, and even a new police station. I am looking forward to the new town release, and I am sure if you buy this game, that you will be excited as well. I really love this game and I think you should give it a try, considering that it is only $20, and goes on sale quite often.       Happy Surviving!             - Zunomic

								I recomend this game and here's why:I bought this game in the sale for Â£7.50 roughly and even at the full price it would have been worth it. I can imagine this game may be quite boring eventually on your own but with friends this game is a blast! I haven't had this much fun on a game in ages! Sure the game is Eary access... and what? I bought this game because I remember it used to have bad reviews but now it's mostly positive which gave me hope, and this means the Dev is trying to actually improve the game instead of abandoning it.The only problems with this game are that you cant loot a container while another player (even your friends) are next to you. Also that you can only get one container per base, but don't let that put you off this brilliant game, there are ways around this. For instance; Getting a tent for storage, using cars for storage etc...I love this game and I know the devs are going to improve it as much as possible. I give this a thumbs up because it's the best zombie survival out there just now! :) go grab it!

content:
Posted: April 25, 2016
Early Access Review
My Miscreated ReviewOne of my 3 favorite games. The game does have lots of bugs, but with every con, their is a pro. Pros:   Fun co-op  Friendly community  Easy to learn  Intense action  Cons  Has a few bugs, mainly with Mutants  Has only 36 player slot on servers current  You can get stuck on things often   Sometimes ammo will be gone after logging on Things I want added to Miscreated  Be able to prone  Combine ammo clips *For example, I have 5 bullets in one clip and 5 in the other, I would be able to combine them  Better optimization (Not bad, but also not the best)  Higher spawns  More slots to servers  More variety of scoped/long range weapons Should you buy it? If you like survival games like H1Z1, DayZ, or Rust, this is a game that you are going to really like. When I bought the game there was an average of about 250 people on, and around 100 on during night time/early morning hours. Now I have seen it at an average of 600-700 people! The game is really growing after Patch #35 which added a "Weather System" and a sneak peak of the new town. Currently the new town is just being called "Downtown" which includes a skyscraper and many houses, gas stations, and even a new police station. I am looking forward to the new town release, and I am sure if you buy this game, that you will be excited as well. I really love this game and I think you should give it a try, considering that it is only $20, and goes on sale quite often.       Happy Surviving!             - Zunomic

content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								So I have a little time played on MIscreated.The weather effects make this game extremely unique. One moment we're searching for weapons/ammunition and then out of nowhere,a massive tornado heads our way. The crafting/base building system is buggy, but exceptional. I enjoy the aspect of being able to find more guides(recipes) out in the world.Opens up options for RP/Etc for servers.Weapons/Ammunition. More than likely you'll find weapons without ammunition not with it.The best thing that happened when first playing Miscreated is when I was first in the server,and I found a pig for the first time. I picked up the pig and began to carry it in my arms.I named him Roger. As I was going to carry him across the map back to base, I accidently dropped him and thenone tapped him with my gun. I only cried a little bit as I was harvesting some of Roger to cook on the fire later.10/10 Would play again in memory of Roger.

content:
Posted: February 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								First off, beautiful graphics! Anyways this is the most well put together, realistic, massive multiplayer game out there! H1Z1 was an atrocious survival game like no one has room to disagree because it turned into a stupid deathmatch game for crying out loud....DayZ Standalone is good but has too many OP weapons, but Miscreated now is a game that makes you feel like you're really in an apocalypse. The houses in miscreated are all different and have vegetation and wear all on and INSIDE the houses, every house and i mean EVERY house varies like its incredible how much work they put into the houses unlike in H1Z1 and DayZ. Next is the weapons. Yes, there aren't many weapons but there are some weapons that actually might be found in towns like a simple hand gun or beaten winchester or huniting rifle (which is super rare), ammo is super hard to find like it really would be in real life which helps lower the D-Bags in the game and really makes people want to make a group instead of kill on sight. Best zombie game yet, runs like a charm, and is definitely worth the money!

Early Access Review
								Miscreated is the only game I purchased during this years summer sale, I believe it was worth the $10.I like where this game is going from a survival and crafting aspect.  However, it is apparent they mimicked a lot of features you will find in Day Z in their own unique way.  I am anxious to see where this game goes but with the recent 0.60 patch with Day Z I find myself still going back to Chernarus. If you are a beginner wanting to give the surival genre a try this game would be a good start for you.UPDATE 01/06/2016:  I have been playing a lot this past week and after exploring more of the map and fixing up a car it has been pretty cool.  I am actually playing this more than Day Z just because its more unique and less buggy.  I know there are some negative comments about base building being glitched but come one guys, the developers already said base building needs attention, no need to blow your load all of the internet.  ITS AN EARLY ACCESS GAME!

content:
Posted: September 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								So I get the game expecting something like DayZ, I was mistaken, I've gotten something much better.I spawn into my first server and hear the distinct sound of a squeaker in the distance. I track the noise to an old white house in Pinecrest. When I spot the wild squeaker it appears that he is testing out controls or doing some type of mating dance tbh idfk what he was doing, anyways, I see the perfect time to strike. I sneak up on the wild squeaker and proceed to punch said beast. To my dismay, the squeaker panics and begins to scream and run around while holding down his VOIP key. He then tries to reason with me and asking to be my friend, I know this was a conspiracy, I couldn't trust a wild animal. So I continue to beat the squeaker. After chasing the squeaker down about 6 blocks, I hear one last shreik of panic and my last punch lands, I scramble to check his loot and long story short I got green pants. :^)Was it worth it? You may ask, and yes it is, one less beast to worry about.10/10 Would beat a squeaker to death again.

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 17, 2016
Early Access Review
								A great open world survival game, you can tell its early access but a lot of things are nice and polished, the game world looks fantastic, swimming in water is super realistic, scavenging dark interiors with only a flash light is immersive.Pros:-great design/ concept-great graphics-detailed world-for an EA game its worth the investment cuz it will only get betterCons:-Mutants are sparse, there are no hordes yet -no real danger besides other people, you wont feel threatened and desperate to find something unless you come across other players, im hoping this changes in future patches and reading up on it seems like they already have plans for it -lots of looting, core gameplay so far is just looting, like i said before the mutants are very few, you will be lucky to see any (you can kill them with anything so its not a threat as of yet)As of this patch right now on 10/17/16The problem so far is there is no incentive to go out and hunt and survive, you can basically kill mutants with a squeegee they are very few, the lack of imminent danger is my only complaint and i know its something they are working on,  as ive stated before its a got great structure and i deff recommend it and keep this game on your radar its only getting better from here,

content:
Posted: August 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								Graphics = 9/10Sound = 8/10Survival Gameplay = 9/10I wanted to get into DayZ, but it was too clunky and buggy. Miscreated is early access and there are a few bugs...You can lose items through the floor, caches can disappear, you can fall through the ground if vehicle is flipped, headshots aren't registering properly, the game used to crash a lot, but a patch fixed most of that, sometimes you will get a black screen but a lot less likely now. There was a whole load of lag before too, but that's mostly gone.The game is rewarding when you find amazing rare items, but you can lose it all in a heartbeat, but that's how this game keeps you on edge. Base building is quite good too, so you can hide your best kit if you aren't looking to PVP. There are no KOS servers, roleplaying and normal servers out there, so you choose what you want to do.Not often do I write reviews, but I wanted to share this game with my friends and got a few of them playing it with me now. Enjoy!

content:
Posted: February 21, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game needs to get out of its "Mixed" review state because it deserves far better than that. I can only assume most of the negative reviews are from an earlier build. Miscreated is better than DayZ: SA in every way possible... Better graphics (thanks to Cryengine), better features, more detailed interiors and the game as a whole is far more optimised than DayZ. It runs smoothly enough without having to tinker around with the graphics settings. Only thing DayZ has over this game is the map size but to be honest, I'd rather play (and enjoy) on a medium sized map than an unplayable mess DayZ is, huge map or not.But change that god awful title logo, Entrada. Makes this game look like a cheap DayZ knock-off but your product is much (MUCH!) better than that.

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 22, 2016
Early Access Review
								I debated a lot whether I should buy this since EA survival games don't really have the best track record, but I must say I don't regret buying this one bit.The Good:It looks and runs amazing well (granted i'm on a 980ti), I haven't even dropped below 60 fps once with maxed settings.Animations especially for the player are actually really well done for the most part. Of course certtain areas of the game such as the mutants need a lot of work, but they're (the devs) well aware of that.There is a lot of interesting loot already in the game and I like how you really have to search hard to find it. Still haven't found any vehicles though.The controls are very responsive (it's not clunky like some other games *cough* *cough*) and easy to pick up. After a solid hour I pretty much had all the controls down. One thing the developers definitely got right was the mood. This game FEELS like an apocalypse happened. There is nothing scarier than being upstairs in an overgrown house that's been turned upside down, at night, in the dark, with your little flickering flashlight, then hearing footsteps of another play slowing walking up. What I'm trying to say is the atmosphere is a 9/10 for me. It's almost perfect.The Bad:Unfortunetly this game just needs time. It's missing a lot of features, it can definitely feel empty at times, there isn't much else to do except collect loot and kill players. It's just one of those games where we are going to have to hope it all comes together in a reasonable amount of time. That being said I do really like where the devs are taking the game. If you listen to their latest Twitch Live Stream they pretty much address all of the major issues with the game and what they're doing to fix it. If it all goes to plan it sounds pretty damn awesome.Conclusion: The fact that the devs are focusing on making survival #1 priority gives me a lot of hope for this game. That plus the cryengine + the seperate AI company + all the new systems being added... well it's looking real good folks. Fingers crossed.

content:
Posted: February 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								Pros-Beautiful, exhilarating, optimized, entertaining, great building system, great loot, logical locations, well structure map, RELATIVELY friendly community (not as much kill on sight bull as DayZ), smooth pvp (not clunky), good voice communication, three chats (area, local, whisper), I' havn't dropped below 60 fps unless loading which is great for a game that requires on the spot decision making (especially when in a firefight)I have not played in a group or clan yet, I assume it's fun and hope to find some groups to hang with. But as of right now I cannot really comment on team play for this game.The Devs are really interactive and value community opinion very highly, this is honestly amazing. They update frequently which doesn't make me question where my money is going, or if this game will finish, because I'm certain it willCons-Buggy AI (although I've heard this will be fixed)Very simplistic inventory overlayNot a whole lot of content YET.Overall if you would like to play a great game, and watch it grow both in content and community, buy this game, and if you enjoy it recommend it to a friend!

								One of the best survival games to date with a great community behind it and a very regular player base .The devs do an amazing job and are constantly active providing regular updates that benefit the game and the way its played .You also cannot fail to notice the landscape around you while you play Miscreated its both visually stunning in appearance and practical when it comes to running and finding cover usually from bandits ( yea i do that a lot ) . content:
Posted: February 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								First off, beautiful graphics! Anyways this is the most well put together, realistic, massive multiplayer game out there! H1Z1 was an atrocious survival game like no one has room to disagree because it turned into a stupid deathmatch game for crying out loud....DayZ Standalone is good but has too many OP weapons, but Miscreated now is a game that makes you feel like you're really in an apocalypse. The houses in miscreated are all different and have vegetation and wear all on and INSIDE the houses, every house and i mean EVERY house varies like its incredible how much work they put into the houses unlike in H1Z1 and DayZ. Next is the weapons. Yes, there aren't many weapons but there are some weapons that actually might be found in towns like a simple hand gun or beaten winchester or huniting rifle (which is super rare), ammo is super hard to find like it really would be in real life which helps lower the D-Bags in the game and really makes people want to make a group instead of kill on sight. Best zombie game yet, runs like a charm, and is definitely worth the money!

content:
Posted: February 24, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game, in my opinion, should not have a mixed review, but more on the positive side.  It is a early access scavenging game that puts you in a "Walking Dead" kind of character role. Servers are very fun when the majority of people on them role play; but the game is also a good banditing game.Pro's (early access Patch #32)Each respawn starts different than the last, and spawn points seem random all over the islandYou can identify if a player has good weapons and gear by looking at them. Guns and weapons appear on character modelsLarge customization options regarding clothingLarge variation of ranged and melee weaponsVERY good atmosphere; constantly looking over your shoulderGameplay is geared towards scavenging for now (until storage is introduced into base building)Good loot comes in some very random places, not always in 1 certain spot.Easy enough to learnBullet physics apply when shooting; varies greatly depending on the gun you have irt bullet velocity, range and dropVery immersive country side with cave systems, hunting cabins, and a variety of vehicles to get around in (HARD TO FIND) Large cities, small towns, woodland communities, and your occasional country home.Gameplay encourages team work and alliancesCon's (Gameplay Less early development typical bugs) You cannot merge clips of ammo, remove bullets from clips; it would be nice to do that so that you're not carrying 4 half empty clips, and can reload your clips when safe. or take my .22 bullets from a clip to use them in a .22 rifleClothing does not yet have defensive bonuses (talk of bringing it in soon)There is no storage unless you have found and fully repaired a truck, but anyone can just come steal your truck and you will lose everything that you have stored in it.The current base building is clunky (that issue will be mostly solved when storage is introduced)It can be too easy to starve to death on populated servers due to many people scavenging / slow item respawn times - unless you find a gun and can kill a couple people who are wearing backpacks, and pray they have stored some food!Weapon and ammo crafting is lacking, or non existent - hopefully will improve as time goes on.I would highly recomend this game to my friends. It has a lot of potential, and from what I hear from friends, it is on it's way to being superior to DayZ. Happy Hunting,Dusty

content:
Posted: February 11
Early Access Review
								REFUNDED:Firstly i had no interest in this game at first until i saw someone else play it recently. Im a sucker for great graphics and games that run well. I was always in 60-70fps on high graphics.This game was alright at first even though the first hour i spent running around trying to find buildings and loot which i found very little of. the rest of the time was pretty awful i ran around the whole map and was unable to find anything other than axes, base ball bats, car parts, and sometimes food. I ran into 3 people during the time i spent playing this game and none of them had anything either. Bases were empty (player bases) and it seemed like nobody was online with me. I was playing on a server with 35 other people not including myself which means a full server and it apparently was times x amount of loot (easier loot) which is basically saying 0x3=0. I cant imagine normal servers loot system if i couldnt even find loot on this server. I really wanted to like this game but i guess ill wait a couple more months or a year to try it again. As of now it has nothing to offer and i was pretty bored the whole time.

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								So, Ive wanted to buy this game since a few months but I always hesitated. It finally got on sale for the Halloween and I bought it. This is my Day #1 experience:1st spawnI had just spawned and I started fixing the video settings and trying to figure out the controls. It was night. Like hella dark, couldn't even see my arms. I started strolling around while I somehow managed to drop my only item, the flashlight (accidentally pressed wrong button). Trying to keep moving, I ended up in the middle of a road. Still couldn't see much and all of a sudden another player showed up and made me almost sh*t my pants. "This is it, I'm dead", I thought. But instead, the guy asked me if I needed anything and even gave me a gun with two bullets and a flashlight! I thanked him and he moved away. I kept following the road when I heard some roars. I noticed an infected in a small distance and panicked as I didn't even know how to equip the gun I had, yet. I decided I could slowly go past him and move away but no, that creepy @ss thing started screaming the hell out of its lungs as I got closer. So I started running till I heard wolves. I finally reached a town and in a few words, I accidentally fell from a big height, started bleeding and slowly, died. Spawn 2I respawned on a different place and after some time of looting around, I bumbed on a Swedish guy. He was really friendly I couldnt even believe it and we eventually teamed up. He taught me some handful survival tricks and tactics and it was all cool when we heard another guy (a Finnish one) who almost blew our minds with his carbine (he thought we would attack him). He got in the squad too and we all had a good time I believe. Few things I learned from the Swedish guy:-NEVER TURN ON YOUR FLASHLIGHT OUTSIDE OF BUILDINGS, you're easy to spot-stay close to bushes and out of the roads-always keep an eye on your health stats; everything below 50% means emergency-try to team up with people (friends playing with you are the best solution) or be careful as they'll probably kill you. -STOP CARRYING USELESS STUFF. even if you find a backpack (which you totally need in such a game), you want to save space for consumables and weapons. Better thing to do is to focus either on building a base, or a car or just surviving and so keep space for your purposes. The game is on Alpha version as stated, yet it lacks very few things from its full release. Mechanics are good, physics are awesome, graphics are exceptional. The menu options aren't many and the user interface is kinda good (it could be better but I see the devs have focused on the rest of the game and some fixes). I only found one small bug where an infected had glitched and stuck with an object but after a few seconds it was ok. The day and time cycle vary on each server as I've read however both night time and day time last long. And finally the game is not heavy especially for newer PCs. My old laptop with: i7 4500U, R9 m265x 2gb, 8gb ram, run at 40-60 fps at low settings with native (1366x768) resolution. However I read, systems with older CPUs and GPUs (e.x. gtx 670 or so) can run the game a lot better. If you like survival games where you can also build a base, create clans or play alone but also like the horror of the infected, this game is totally for you. 8.5/10 because of the lack of options on the menu. **Another last thing: If you play or want to play this game, don't be the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ who kills another survivor for no reason! Live and let live!

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 11, 2016
Early Access Review
								As much I want to like this game, it has a lot of issues.  I know, this game is "Pre-Alpha".  But I really just don't fall for that junk anymore.  Some of the bugs basically make this game unplayable, such as your game freezing and losing all of your gear (on a computer that easily runs the game).  The fact that the mutants pose almost no threat at all to you because there are so few of them that you can play for hours and only see one or two at most.  There are so called "PVE" servers, but they are pointless and boring because there really isn't any environment to survive against.  Without other players to compete against, there really is no threat to your survival as long as you continue to loot.  Which turns out to have basically no value because you have gear but nothing to use it for, since mutant sightings are so rare.  In PVP other plays almost always Kill on Sight, and although this can be fun for the ambushing bandit; it tends to be extremely frustrating for the naked spawn who can't even get started without being killed.  Having tried to team up with others, this can be equally frustrating because one minute you are dropping them free gear, and the next they standby and watch someone hack you to death.  Then your "ally" loots your body.  Then when you come back to see if your gear is still on your body your "allies" purposely run over you with a car.  Unless you play with people you know it is pointless to try to team up and work together, because your ally is just as likely to shoot you in the back and steal your stuff as a bandit is.  I feel like with hundreds of thousands of dollars (or millions) that have been paid for this game that it should be further along than it is.  They try to rush these games out so quickly onto the steam market so they can start making money that they really never focus on any one part of the game at a time, instead opting to VERY slowly expand features of the game instead of addressing the bugs that tend to make the game unplayable.  Same thing goes for games like DayZ, H1Z1, etc. No one likes to log in and find that all of their gear is gone, especially when they spend 20 hours trying to survive bandits who KOS just to get some decent gear.This game has a lot of potential.  I just hope that they can fix the bugs and also make the game worth playing for PVE players.  No AI enemies makes this game more of a walking simulator than anything else.

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								I won't talk about the game mechanics or anything, instead ill tell you a story. It was dead at night, I had been shuffling around a houseÂ  with my flashlight on looking for stuff, when I heard whistling outside. I cursed my luck and clicked out my flashlight, pulling out my baseball bat. Thats when it got scary. It was pitch black, couldnt see a thing, all I could hear was whistling all around. "I saw your flashlight." A man said, and I heard footsteps slowly coming up the stairs. I was shaking in my boots now. There was no way out. A light shone up the stairs, but I was in the corner. Up, up up they came, and just when I thought I was screwed. Bam bam bam! Shots lit up the night, the guys screamed. They were under attack. They started firing left and right, one guy came upstairs hit and I killed him with my bat, the other two were firing out the window. I grabbed the guys gun and his clothes, as well as his gear, and went back down. "JOHN! HELP US TAKE THESE GUYS OUT!" They shouted spotting me, and I walked towards them. But instead, I shot them both in the head. I called out,"Im freindly! I helped take these guys out!" Turns out a friendly foreign guy saved me, we traveled together, until he tragically jumped in front of a bullet for me, and then I died by a stray molotov moments later. 10/10. Game will give you great memories.

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								Miscreated, a great game full of well-implemented features and a lot of bugs.I have thoroughly enjoyed this game. I have spent time experimenting with the base-building features and I've got to say, they're really good. Base building allows the player freedom to build however he/she chooses. Every base can be built differently and is unique. For me, PVP in Miscreated has and will continue to be a big part of the game. This may be due to the lack of PVE content, but it is also a lot of fun. I've spent a lot of time combating both large and small groups. It's a dangerous world, and I really enjoy it. PVE content could be improved by adding more environmental dangers, more variations of mutants and even hordes of mutants. The survival aspect of this game is spot on. I've had several occasions where my friends and myself have almost died due to starvation. This also forces PVP and confrontation because you need food to survive. It really helps capture the brutality and savagery generally associated with a post-apocalyptic society. However, it is relatively easy to get water through rivers, ponds and much more. The visuals of Miscreated are incredible. The weather is incredible and I often find myself just admiring how good it is. The developers have done a very good job implementing weather and environmental visuals. There are many vehicles to choose from in Miscreated. The fact that there are a limited number spawned at once makes getting one feel like an achievement. Unfortunately though, the vehicles have issues. They can randomly cause you to die. This could be by falling through the floor, randomly dying when getting out of it or just flipping for some trivial reason. You can also expect to get disconnected while driving. This often leads to you losing the vehicle to someone else.There are so many other bugs I can report on. There is falling through the floor and losing everything if you can't swim through the "underworld" quick enough. Of course there is dropping items and having them disappear. I found that quite frustrating. I could go on but the list is long. Despite the bugs, the game is still amazing and has so much potential. The developers are actively improving and updating the game with new content and bug fixes. It is definitely a game worth purchasing. I highly recommend it.

content:
Posted: September 15, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've played this game for over a year now and let me tell you this game has grown and improved alot considering how small the developement team is. They update the game consistantly with huge patches, fixing bugs and adding new items, weapons, clothes and vehicles with every patch.(I've also purchased 5 copies for steam friends.)The reason i love this game is i cant find a single other game that can get my heart pumping like this game can. Every interaction you have is unique and challenging. The AI system is decent right now, since they released the new ai its gotten alot better and have added alot of new mutants and mutant packs.Sure it's not perfect, i mean its still a work in progress. The only buggs ive ever experienced is items falling through the floor(particularly ammo clips) and some slight visual bugs sometimes. There are no game breaking bugs honestly, my pc isn't anything special and I get 60 fps no crashes.If you are looking for a good mmo survival game then buy this game, its way better compared to the other EA garbage that plagued the steam community over the past couple of years. Buy this game and kill the garbage.

Every base can be built differently and is unique. For me, PVP in Miscreated has and will continue to be a big part of the game. This may be due to the lack of PVE content, but it is also a lot of fun. I've spent a lot of time combating both large and small groups. It's a dangerous world, and I really enjoy it. PVE content could be improved by adding more environmental dangers, more variations of mutants and even hordes of mutants. The survival aspect of this game is spot on. I've had several occasions where my friends and myself have almost died due to starvation. This also forces PVP and confrontation because you need food to survive. It really helps capture the brutality and savagery generally associated with a post-apocalyptic society. However, it is relatively easy to get water through rivers, ponds and much more. The visuals of Miscreated are incredible. The weather is incredible and I often find myself just admiring how good it is. The developers have done a very good job implementing weather and environmental visuals. There are many vehicles to choose from in Miscreated. I found that quite frustrating. I could go on but the list is long. Despite the bugs, the game is still amazing and has so much potential. content:

Early Access Review
								I've played this game for over a year now and let me tell you this game has grown and improved alot considering how small the developement team is. They update the game consistantly with huge patches, fixing bugs and adding new items, weapons, clothes and vehicles with every patch.(I've also purchased 5 copies for steam friends.)The reason i love this game is i cant find a single other game that can get my heart pumping like this game can. Every interaction you have is unique and challenging. The AI system is decent right now, since they released the new ai its gotten alot better and have added alot of new mutants and mutant packs.Sure it's not perfect, i mean its still a work in progress. The only buggs ive ever experienced is items falling through the floor(particularly ammo clips) and some slight visual bugs sometimes. There are no game breaking bugs honestly, my pc isn't anything special and I get 60 fps no crashes.If you are looking for a good mmo survival game then buy this game, its way better compared to the other EA garbage that plagued the steam community over the past couple of years. Buy this game and kill the garbage.

content:

Early Access Review
								Somehow I haven't left a review on this game even though I've put 300+ hours in. Awesome, open world game where danger could be creeping just around the corner at any moment! Had so much fun playing solo, or with friends. A little discouraging when you die, as you lose all the stuff you spent (potentially) hours finding, but once you get used to the game, it's not difficult to gear up again if you know the right places to loot. Base building is ok but they look like shipping crates. I would rather they added something that allowed players or clans to take over homes in the city or something like that. Either way, amazing game, amazing graphics, thrilling and realistic guns, vehicles, textures overall. Also some nice hidden places like bunkers and caves if you're the exploring type. :) Worth the money.
